profiledesc.creation: EAD encoding by Karen Spilman May 2005

did.repository: University of Minnesota Libraries. University Archives [uarc]
did.abstract: The collection contains the papers of William M. Bart, professor of psychology at the University of Minnesota.

accessrestrict.head: Use of Materials
accessrestrict.p: Items in this collection do not circulate and may be used in-house only.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: Requests for permission to quote from the William M. Bart papers should be arranged with the University of Minnesota Archives head.

prefercite.head: Preferred citation
prefercite.p: William M. Bart papers, University of Minnesota Archives.

acqinfo.head: Source of acquisition
acqinfo.p: The collection was deposited in University Archives on November 7, 1985.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection contains speeches, reprints and evaluations in the fields of psychology, learning and intelligence.

bioghist.head: Biographical Sketch of William M. Bart
bioghist.p: William M. Bart is a professor of psychology at the University of Minnesota, specializing in learning and cognition. He earned his Ph.D. from the University of Chicago in 1969.

controlaccess.head: Index Terms
controlaccess.p: This collection is indexed under the following headings in the catalog of the University of Minnesota Libraries. Researchers desiring materials about related topics, persons or places should search the catalog using these headings.
controlaccess.corpname: University of Minnesota. Dept. of Psychology
controlaccess.subject: Learning, Psychology of
